After surviving the [[Downfall of Númenor]], [[Elendil]] landed in Middle-earth, proclaiming some words in [[Quenya]]. His heir and great-grandson by 39 generations [[Aragorn|Aragorn II]] spoke these words again when he took up the [[Crown of Gondor]] as [[Aragorn|King Elessar]] at the beginning of the [[Fourth Age]]:

{{blockquote|'''Et Eärello Endorenna utúlien. Sinomë maruvan ar Hildinyar tenn' Ambar-metta'''. [...] Out of the [[Great Sea]] to [[Middle-earth]] I am come. In this place will I abide, and my heirs, unto the [[the End|ending of the world]].<ref>{{RK|VI5}}, p. 967</ref>}}

==Portrayals==
[[Howard Shore]] used the oath as part of the "[[The Great River (soundtrack)|The Great River]]" track for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring|The Fellowship of the Ring]]'' film. [[Viggo Mortensen]] provided the melody for the words in the [[The Return of the King (soundtrack)|track]] for the [[The Return of the King (scene)|coronation scene]] in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King|The Return of the King]]''.
